testDescriptions.CBC: Complete Blood Count (CBC) measures red and white blood cells, hemoglobin, and platelets to detect anemia and infections, crucial for monitoring maternal and fetal health.
testDescriptions.Blood Group: Blood Group testing determines maternal blood type and Rh factor, essential for managing Rh compatibility and transfusion needs during pregnancy.
testDescriptions.Glucose (F/ PR/ R/ PG): Glucose tests (Fasting, Postprandial, Random, Post Glucose) monitor blood sugar levels to detect and manage gestational diabetes.
testDescriptions.TSH Ultra: Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone (TSH) Ultra test checks thyroid function, vital for maintaining maternal metabolism and supporting fetal development.
testDescriptions.Urine Routine: Urine Routine analysis screens for urinary tract infections and kidney issues, ensuring a healthy pregnancy by detecting potential complications early.
testDescriptions.VDRL: VDRL test screens for syphilis, preventing serious pregnancy complications and ensuring timely treatment to protect maternal and fetal health.
testDescriptions.ELISA: ELISA test detects antibodies for infections and autoimmune conditions, crucial for early intervention and maintaining a healthy pregnancy.
testDescriptions.Serology (HIV, HBSAG, HCV): Serology tests for HIV, Hepatitis B (HBSAG), and Hepatitis C (HCV) identify viral infections, essential for preventing transmission and managing maternal health.

faqs.purpose: Antenatal tests are conducted during pregnancy to monitor the health of the pregnant person and fetus, identify potential complications early, and ensure appropriate interventions for a healthy pregnancy and delivery.
faqs.importance: These tests ensure a safe, healthy pregnancy by identifying potential issues early, protecting both maternal and fetal health, and allowing for timely interventions to address any complications.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: All pregnant individuals should get antenatal tests to monitor their health and the developing fetusâ€™s well-being. These tests are essential for ensuring a healthy pregnancy and addressing any potential issues promptly.

name: Diabetes Monitoring Panel - 1

testDescriptions.HbA1c: Measures average blood glucose levels over the past three months, essential for long-term diabetes management and control.
testDescriptions.Fasting Glucose: Assesses blood sugar levels after fasting, crucial for diagnosing and monitoring diabetes.
testDescriptions.Postprandial Glucose: Measures blood sugar levels after meals to evaluate how well diabetes is managed post-eating.
testDescriptions.Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN): Monitors kidney function by evaluating waste levels in the blood, helping detect diabetes-related kidney damage.
testDescriptions.Creatinine: Evaluates kidney health by measuring waste product levels, crucial for detecting complications from diabetes.
testDescriptions.Uric Acid: Checks uric acid levels in the blood to prevent gout, which can be associated with diabetes.
testDescriptions.Total Cholesterol: Assesses overall cholesterol levels, important for managing cardiovascular risks linked to diabetes.
testDescriptions.HDL Cholesterol: Measures 'good' cholesterol levels, helping lower the risk of heart disease in diabetes patients.
testDescriptions.Triglycerides: Evaluates fat levels in the blood, crucial for reducing heart disease risk in diabetes.
testDescriptions.Direct LDL Cholesterol: Measures 'bad' cholesterol directly, essential for managing heart health in diabetes.
testDescriptions.Microalbumin Random Urine: Detects small amounts of albumin in urine, an early sign of diabetic kidney disease.
testDescriptions.Urinary Microalbumin: Assesses kidney health by detecting protein leakage, indicating potential complications from diabetes.

faqs.purpose: To monitor diabetes management and assess kidney and cardiovascular health by tracking blood glucose levels, cholesterol, and urine microalbumin.
faqs.importance: These tests help track blood sugar control, detect complications early, and ensure effective management of diabetes and its related health risks.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Individuals with diabetes or those at risk of developing diabetes should consider this panel for regular monitoring and assessment of their condition.

note: Diabetes Monitoring Panel - 2 includes insulin fasting and urine routine tests, offering a more detailed assessment of diabetes management compared to Panel - 1.

name: Diabetes Monitoring Panel - 2

testDescriptions.HbA1c: Measures average blood glucose levels over the past three months, essential for long-term diabetes management and control.
testDescriptions.Fasting Glucose: Assesses blood sugar levels after fasting, essential for diagnosing and monitoring diabetes.
testDescriptions.Postprandial Glucose: Measures blood sugar levels after meals to evaluate how well diabetes is managed post-eating.
testDescriptions.Serum Creatinine: Evaluates kidney health by measuring waste product levels, important for detecting complications from diabetes.
testDescriptions.Uric Acid: Checks uric acid levels in the blood to prevent gout, which can be associated with diabetes.
testDescriptions.Total Cholesterol: Assesses overall cholesterol levels, important for managing cardiovascular risks linked to diabetes.
testDescriptions.HDL Cholesterol: Measures 'good' cholesterol levels, helping lower the risk of heart disease in diabetes patients.
testDescriptions.Triglycerides: Evaluates fat levels in the blood, crucial for reducing heart disease risk in diabetes.
testDescriptions.Direct LDL Cholesterol: Measures 'bad' cholesterol directly, essential for managing heart health in diabetes.
testDescriptions.Insulin Fasting: Assesses fasting insulin levels to help manage insulin therapy and diabetes control.
testDescriptions.Microalbumin Random: Detects small amounts of albumin in urine, an early sign of diabetic kidney disease.
testDescriptions.Urine Routine and Microscopy: Examines urine for abnormalities, aiding in the detection of kidney issues and infections associated with diabetes.

faqs.purpose: To monitor diabetes management, insulin levels, and overall kidney and cardiovascular health by tracking blood glucose, cholesterol, and urine health.
faqs.importance: These tests provide comprehensive insights into blood sugar control, insulin levels, and potential complications, aiding in optimal diabetes management and preventing related health issues.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Individuals with diabetes, prediabetes, or those managing insulin therapy should consider this panel for a thorough assessment of their condition.

note: Diabetes Monitoring Panel - 2 includes insulin fasting and urine routine tests, offering a more detailed assessment of diabetes management compared to Panel - 1.

testDescriptions.CBC: Complete Blood Count (CBC) measures various components of blood to detect anemia and signs of inflammation, which are crucial for assessing overall health in arthritis patients.
testDescriptions.ESR: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) measures the rate at which red blood cells settle in a tube over a specific period. Elevated rates indicate inflammation, helping diagnose and monitor arthritis and its severity.
testDescriptions.SGPT: SGPT (ALT) is a liver enzyme test that assesses liver function. Monitoring SGPT levels is important to ensure that liver function remains stable, especially during arthritis treatment.
testDescriptions.SGOT: SGOT (AST) is another liver enzyme test that evaluates liver function and helps monitor potential liver damage, which can be a side effect of arthritis medications.
testDescriptions.Urea: The Urea test measures kidney function by evaluating the concentration of urea in the blood. This is important as certain arthritis treatments can impact kidney function.
testDescriptions.Uric Acid: The Uric Acid test checks for elevated levels of uric acid in the blood, which can indicate gout, a type of arthritis characterized by sudden and severe pain and inflammation.
testDescriptions.CRP: C-Reactive Protein (CRP) measures the level of CRP in the blood, which increases in response to inflammation. This test helps in diagnosing and monitoring inflammatory arthritis conditions.
testDescriptions.RA Factor: Rheumatoid Factor (RA Factor) is a test that detects antibodies associated with rheumatoid arthritis. It aids in the diagnosis and monitoring of rheumatoid arthritis.
testDescriptions.ANA: Antinuclear Antibody (ANA) test screens for autoimmune disorders, such as lupus, which can present with arthritis-like symptoms and affect joint health.
testDescriptions.Urine Routine: Urine Routine analysis examines urine for abnormalities, helping detect kidney issues or infections, which can be complications of arthritis or its treatments.

faqs.purpose: To diagnose different types of arthritis, monitor levels of inflammation, and evaluate liver and kidney function, which can be affected by arthritis or its treatments.
faqs.importance: These tests provide a comprehensive view of inflammation, joint health, liver and kidney function, and help guide effective treatment and management of arthritis.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Individuals experiencing joint pain, swelling, or stiffness, or those who suspect they might have arthritis, should consider this panel. It is also useful for monitoring existing arthritis conditions.

testDescriptions.CBC: Complete Blood Count (CBC) detects anemia and inflammation, essential for evaluating overall health and monitoring arthritis-related conditions.
testDescriptions.ESR: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) measures inflammation levels, aiding in the diagnosis and monitoring of arthritis severity.
testDescriptions.Uric Acid: Identifies elevated levels indicating gout, a type of inflammatory arthritis.
testDescriptions.CRP: C-Reactive Protein (CRP) measures inflammation, crucial for diagnosing and tracking inflammatory arthritis conditions.
testDescriptions.RA Factor: Rheumatoid Factor (RA Factor) detects antibodies linked to rheumatoid arthritis, aiding in diagnosis and disease monitoring.
testDescriptions.ASO: Antistreptolysin O (ASO) titer detects streptococcal infections, which can trigger reactive arthritis.
testDescriptions.ANA: Antinuclear Antibody (ANA) test screens for autoimmune diseases like lupus, often associated with arthritis symptoms.
testDescriptions.Anti-CCP: Anti-Cyclic Citrullinated Peptide (Anti-CCP) detects specific antibodies in rheumatoid arthritis, crucial for early diagnosis and prognosis.
testDescriptions.Urine Routine: Analysis detects kidney issues and infections, which can be complications of arthritis or its treatments.

faqs.purpose: To diagnose and monitor arthritis by evaluating blood health, inflammation, autoimmune markers, and uric acid levels.
faqs.importance: These tests provide detailed diagnostics and guide targeted treatment for arthritis.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Individuals with suspected autoimmune arthritis or persistent joint symptoms should get this panel.

name: NIROGYAM D PLUS

testDescriptions.CBC: Complete Blood Count (CBC) detects anemia, infection, and inflammation, providing a comprehensive overview of overall health.
testDescriptions.ESR: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) measures inflammation levels, aiding in the diagnosis and monitoring of chronic diseases.
testDescriptions.HbA1c: Measures average blood sugar levels over three months, crucial for diagnosing and managing diabetes.
testDescriptions.Sugar Fasting: Fasting Blood Sugar tests blood glucose levels after fasting, helping diagnose diabetes and monitor glucose control.
testDescriptions.LFT: Liver Function Tests (LFT) assess liver health by measuring enzymes and proteins, detecting liver damage or disease.
testDescriptions.LDH: Lactate Dehydrogenase (LDH) indicates tissue damage and inflammation, aiding in the diagnosis of various conditions.
testDescriptions.GGT: Gamma-Glutamyl Transferase (GGT) evaluates liver and bile duct function, helping detect liver disease and alcohol abuse.
testDescriptions.Lipid Profile: Measures cholesterol and triglyceride levels, assessing cardiovascular health and the risk of heart disease.
testDescriptions.KFT: Kidney Function Tests (KFT) measure waste products in the blood, evaluating kidney health and detecting renal disorders.
testDescriptions.Iron Profile: Tests iron levels, detecting anemia and other conditions related to iron deficiency or overload.
testDescriptions.Urinary Microalbumin: Detects early kidney damage, particularly in diabetes and hypertension patients.
testDescriptions.Electrolytes: Measures levels of essential minerals, ensuring proper muscle, nerve, and organ function.
testDescriptions.T3: Thyroxine (T3) measures thyroid hormone levels, helping diagnose thyroid dysfunction.
testDescriptions.T4: Thyroxine (T4) measures thyroid hormone levels, assisting in the diagnosis of thyroid disorders.
testDescriptions.TSH: Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone (TSH) measures thyroid function, crucial for diagnosing hypo- or hyperthyroidism.
testDescriptions.25-OH Vitamin D: Measures vitamin D levels, essential for bone health and immune function.
testDescriptions.Vitamin B12: Detects vitamin B12 levels, identifying deficiencies that can cause anemia and neurological issues.
testDescriptions.Urine Routine: Examines urine for infections, kidney issues, and metabolic disorders through analysis of urine components.

faqs.purpose: To provide a comprehensive assessment of overall health, including blood health, glucose levels, liver and kidney function, vitamin levels, and urine health.
faqs.importance: These tests provide a broad overview of health, helping diagnose and manage various conditions and monitor treatment progress.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Individuals needing a thorough health checkup, especially those with chronic conditions or symptoms affecting multiple systems.

note: Nirogyam D Plus focuses on general health and metabolic assessments, while Nirogyam Maximum includes additional tests for autoimmune conditions, inflammation markers, and comprehensive nutrient evaluation.

faqs.purpose: To provide an extensive evaluation of overall health, including autoimmune markers, inflammatory indicators, and additional vitamins and minerals.
faqs.importance: These tests offer detailed insights into health, aiding in accurate diagnosis, monitoring autoimmune conditions, and managing complex health concerns.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Individuals with chronic conditions, autoimmune symptoms, or complex health issues needing an in-depth evaluation.

note: Nirogyam D Plus focuses on general health and metabolic assessments, while Nirogyam Maximum includes additional tests for autoimmune conditions, inflammation markers, and comprehensive nutrient evaluation.

testDescriptions.Anti-Mullerian Hormone (AMH): AMH assesses ovarian reserve, essential for evaluating fertility potential and overall reproductive health.
testDescriptions.Estradiol: Measures estrogen levels, crucial for understanding reproductive health, menstrual cycles, and hormonal balance.
testDescriptions.Progesterone: Evaluates luteal phase function and supports pregnancy, aiding in diagnosing fertility issues and menstrual irregularities.
testDescriptions.Luteinizing Hormone (LH): Regulates ovulation and testosterone levels, vital for diagnosing reproductive health and endocrine disorders.
testDescriptions.Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH): Stimulates ovarian follicles and sperm production, important for assessing fertility and reproductive function.
testDescriptions.Prolactin: Regulates milk production and affects reproductive health, helping diagnose fertility issues and menstrual disorders.
testDescriptions.Ultra-Sensitive Thyroid Stimulating Horm: Evaluates thyroid function, essential for diagnosing thyroid disorders and managing metabolic health.
testDescriptions.Testosterone Free & Total: Measures hormone levels, important for assessing hormonal balance, reproductive health, and diagnosing endocrine disorders.

faqs.purpose: These tests assess hormonal balance, fertility, and reproductive health, providing a comprehensive overview for diagnosing endocrine and reproductive disorders.
faqs.importance: Ensures proper diagnosis and treatment of hormone-related issues, improves chances of achieving and maintaining good reproductive health, and supports effective management of fertility and endocrine conditions.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Individuals experiencing irregular periods, fertility issues, hormonal imbalances, or those planning to conceive or undergoing fertility treatments.

name: BIO T PLUS

testDescriptions.CBC: Complete Blood Count (CBC) measures blood cells to detect anemia, infections, and overall health, aiding in early disease detection.
testDescriptions.Differential Leukocyte Count: Identifies white blood cell types, helping diagnose infections, immune disorders, and various blood-related conditions.
testDescriptions.Glucose Fasting: Tests blood sugar levels after fasting, crucial for diagnosing and managing diabetes and metabolic disorders.
testDescriptions.Lipid Profile: Measures cholesterol and triglycerides, assessing cardiovascular health and risk factors for heart disease and stroke.
testDescriptions.Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN): Evaluates kidney function by measuring waste levels in the blood, aiding in kidney disease diagnosis and management.
testDescriptions.Creatinine: Measures kidney function and health by evaluating waste product levels, crucial for detecting renal disorders.
testDescriptions.Uric Acid: Identifies elevated levels that can cause gout and kidney stones, helping manage and prevent these conditions.
testDescriptions.Calcium: Measures blood calcium levels, essential for bone health and diagnosing conditions like osteoporosis and parathyroid disorders.
testDescriptions.LFT: Assesses liver health by measuring enzymes and proteins, crucial for diagnosing liver diseases and monitoring liver function.
testDescriptions.LDH: Measures enzyme levels linked to tissue damage, aiding in diagnosing and monitoring various health conditions.
testDescriptions.Thyroid Profile (T3, T4, TSH): Evaluates thyroid gland function, diagnosing hypo- or hyperthyroidism, and managing related disorders.

faqs.purpose: Tests for blood health, glucose, cholesterol, kidney function, uric acid, calcium, liver function, and thyroid function.
faqs.importance: Helps diagnose and monitor various health conditions, ensuring effective management of metabolic and organ functions.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Individuals needing a broad health assessment or managing conditions affecting blood, metabolism, and organ function.

note: Bio T D Plus includes HbA1c, providing additional insight into long-term glucose management compared to Bio T Plus.

testDescriptions.Hb: Hemoglobin (Hb) measures red blood cell levels, essential for diagnosing anemia and assessing overall blood health.
testDescriptions.TLC: Total Leukocyte Count (TLC) evaluates white blood cell levels, aiding in diagnosing infections, inflammation, and immune disorders.
testDescriptions.DLC: Differential Leukocyte Count (DLC) identifies white blood cell types, helping diagnose specific infections, immune disorders, and blood conditions.
testDescriptions.Glucose Fasting: Fasting Blood Glucose tests measure sugar levels after fasting, crucial for diagnosing and managing diabetes and metabolic disorders.
testDescriptions.Cholesterol Total: Total Cholesterol measures overall cholesterol levels, assessing cardiovascular risk and guiding prevention of heart disease and stroke.
testDescriptions.Bilirubin: Bilirubin test evaluates liver function by measuring bilirubin levels, crucial for diagnosing liver disorders and jaundice.
testDescriptions.Protein Total: Total Protein measures blood protein levels, helping diagnose liver and kidney diseases and assess nutritional status.
testDescriptions.Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN): BUN tests kidney function by evaluating waste levels in the blood, essential for diagnosing and managing kidney disease.
testDescriptions.Urea: Urea test measures kidney function and waste elimination, aiding in diagnosing renal disorders and monitoring kidney health.
testDescriptions.Creatinine: Creatinine test evaluates kidney function by measuring waste levels, crucial for diagnosing and managing renal conditions.
testDescriptions.Uric Acid: Uric Acid test identifies high levels that can lead to gout and kidney stones, assisting in effective management and prevention.
testDescriptions.Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH): TSH test evaluates thyroid gland function, helping diagnose hypo- or hyperthyroidism and manage related health conditions.

faqs.purpose: The Ayushya Panel - 1 helps detect and manage conditions such as diabetes, cardiovascular disease, liver disorders, kidney disease, thyroid dysfunction, and anemia, ensuring a thorough evaluation of overall health.
faqs.importance: Provides essential insights into multiple health aspects, aiding in the early detection and management of common and chronic conditions.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Ideal for individuals seeking a basic health checkup, including those with symptoms of anemia, diabetes, cardiovascular issues, or thyroid disorders.

testDescriptions.CBC: Complete Blood Count (CBC) assesses overall health by measuring red and white blood cells, helping diagnose anemia, infections, and other blood disorders.
testDescriptions.Differential Leukocyte Count: Differential Leukocyte Count identifies white blood cell types, crucial for diagnosing infections, immune system disorders, and evaluating overall immune health.
testDescriptions.ESR: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) measures inflammation levels in the body, aiding in diagnosing and monitoring inflammatory diseases and conditions like arthritis and infections.
testDescriptions.Glucose Fasting: Fasting Blood Glucose tests sugar levels after fasting, essential for diagnosing diabetes and managing metabolic health and related complications.
testDescriptions.Cholesterol Total: Total Cholesterol measures overall cholesterol levels, helping assess cardiovascular risk and guiding prevention of heart disease and stroke.
testDescriptions.Triglycerides Serum: Triglycerides Serum test measures fat levels in the blood, crucial for evaluating cardiovascular risk and managing metabolic syndrome.
testDescriptions.Bilirubin Total: Total Bilirubin evaluates liver function and helps diagnose liver disorders, jaundice, and bile duct issues, supporting effective treatment.
testDescriptions.SGPT: Serum Glutamic Pyruvic Transaminase (SGPT) measures liver enzyme levels, crucial for detecting liver damage and monitoring liver health and function.
testDescriptions.SGOT: Serum Glutamic Oxaloacetic Transaminase (SGOT) assesses liver health by measuring enzyme levels, helping diagnose liver disorders and monitor treatment progress.
testDescriptions.Protein Total Serum: Total Protein Serum test measures blood protein levels, helping diagnose liver and kidney diseases and assessing overall nutritional status.
testDescriptions.Blood Urea: Blood Urea evaluates kidney function by measuring waste products, essential for diagnosing and managing renal disorders.
testDescriptions.Creatinine: Creatinine test measures kidney function by assessing waste levels, crucial for diagnosing kidney diseases and monitoring renal health.
testDescriptions.Urea: Urea test measures waste elimination efficiency, aiding in diagnosing kidney function issues and monitoring renal health.
testDescriptions.Uric Acid: Uric Acid test identifies high levels linked to gout and kidney stones, helping manage and prevent these conditions effectively.
testDescriptions.TSH: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH) evaluates thyroid function, diagnosing hypo- or hyperthyroidism and managing related health conditions for optimal thyroid health.

faqs.purpose: The Ayushya Panel - 2 offers a thorough health checkup by assessing blood components, glucose, cholesterol, liver and kidney function, and thyroid health for comprehensive disease detection and management.
faqs.differenceFromPanel1: Ayushya Panel - 2 includes ESR for inflammation assessment and Triglycerides Serum for a deeper cardiovascular risk evaluation. Additionally, it adds SGPT and SGOT for detailed liver function analysis, and provides a more comprehensive thyroid function assessment with TSH.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: Recommended for those needing a comprehensive evaluation of inflammation, liver, cardiovascular, and kidney health, or experiencing symptoms related to these areas.

testDescriptions.CBC: Complete Blood Count (CBC) assesses overall blood health by measuring red and white blood cells, identifying anemia, infections, and various blood disorders for effective management.
testDescriptions.Differential Leukocyte Count: Differential Leukocyte Count identifies white blood cell types, aiding in diagnosing specific infections, immune disorders, and monitoring immune system health.
testDescriptions.ESR: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) measures inflammation levels in the body, helping diagnose and monitor inflammatory diseases such as arthritis and chronic infections.
testDescriptions.Glucose Fasting: Fasting Blood Glucose tests blood sugar levels after fasting, crucial for diagnosing diabetes and managing glucose-related health issues.
testDescriptions.Cholesterol Total: Total Cholesterol measures overall cholesterol levels, assessing cardiovascular risk and guiding prevention strategies for heart disease and stroke.
testDescriptions.Triglycerides Serum: Triglycerides Serum test measures fat levels in the blood, essential for evaluating cardiovascular health and managing metabolic syndrome risks.
testDescriptions.LFT: Liver Function Tests (LFT) assesses liver health by measuring enzymes and proteins, crucial for diagnosing liver disorders and monitoring liver function.
testDescriptions.LDH: Lactate Dehydrogenase (LDH) measures enzyme levels related to tissue damage, assisting in diagnosing and monitoring various health conditions and diseases.
testDescriptions.Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN): BUN evaluates kidney function by measuring waste levels in the blood, crucial for diagnosing and managing kidney disease and monitoring renal health.
testDescriptions.Creatinine: Creatinine test measures kidney function by assessing waste product levels, essential for diagnosing renal disorders and tracking kidney health.
testDescriptions.Urea: Urea test measures the efficiency of waste elimination by the kidneys, aiding in diagnosing renal function issues and managing kidney health.
testDescriptions.Uric Acid: Uric Acid test identifies high levels associated with gout and kidney stones, assisting in managing and preventing these conditions.
testDescriptions.TSH: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH) evaluates thyroid gland function, helping diagnose hypo- or hyperthyroidism and manage thyroid-related health conditions effectively.
testDescriptions.Calcium: Calcium test measures levels in the blood, important for assessing bone health, diagnosing osteoporosis, and managing parathyroid disorders.
testDescriptions.Vitamin B12: Vitamin B12 test assesses vitamin levels essential for nerve function and red blood cell production, aiding in diagnosing deficiencies and related health issues.
testDescriptions.Urine Routine: Urine Routine test analyzes urine composition, helping diagnose urinary tract infections, kidney disease, and overall metabolic health.

faqs.purpose: The Ayushya Panel - 3 provides a thorough health assessment by evaluating blood, glucose, cholesterol, liver, kidney, thyroid function, and vitamins, ensuring comprehensive disease detection and effective management.
faqs.differenceFromPanel1And2: Ayushya Panel - 3 includes LFT and LDH for a detailed liver function analysis and more extensive kidney function tests compared to Panels 1 and 2. It also adds Calcium and Vitamin B12 assessments for a broader evaluation of bone health and nutritional status, and incorporates a Urine Routine test for complete urinary health assessment.
faqs.whoShouldGetTested: It is best for individuals seeking an in-depth health assessment, including liver, kidney, thyroid function, and nutrient levels, or those with complex health concerns or chronic conditions.
